Article.Abstract: Transgenic mice expressing chimeric human leukocyte antigen (HLA)-B*0702 and murine H-2K(b) class I molecules were evaluated as a model system to study the immunogenicity of human cytotoxic T lymphocyte epitopes. Immunization of these mice with six known HLA-B*0702-restricted cytotoxic T lymphocyte epitopes emulsified in incomplete Freund's adjuvant induced significant immune responses specific for all six epitopes. A comparison of the immune responses between HLA-B*0702/K(b) and HLA-A*0201/K(b) transgenic mice demonstrated that the HLA-B*0702/K(b) mice possess a T-cell receptor repertoire capable of recognizing human B*0702 epitopes. However, the magnitude of B*0702-specific responses induced in B*0702/K(b) mice were approximately tenfold lower than A*0201-specific responses induced in HLA-A*0201/K(b) transgenic mice. A panel of 24 B*0702 motif-bearing peptides was used to examine the relationship between immunogenicity and HLA-B*0702 binding capacity. All seven peptides with high binding affinities of 50% inhibitory concentration < or =50 NM (IC(50) 50 nM or less) were immunogenic. Similarly, 75% (9 of 12) of the intermediate binders (IC(50) nM of 50-500) were also immunogenic. Finally, only two of five peptides with binding capacity > 500 nM were found to have marginal immunogenicity, whereas the other three were completely negative. HLA-B*0702/K(b) transgenic mice were found to induce B*0702-specific responses after immunization with whole DNA genes or minigenes, suggesting that, at least to some degree, B*0702 epitopes were generated as a result of natural in vivo processing and presentation.
Article.ArticleTitle: Derivation of HLA-B*0702 transgenic mice: functional CTL repertoire and recognition of human B*0702-restricted CTL epitopes.
Article.Affiliations: Epimmune Inc., San Diego, California 92121, USA. jalexander@epimmune.com.
Article.ArticleChemicalList: Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte;H-2 Antigens;H-2Kb protein, mouse;HLA-A Antigens;HLA-A*02:01 antigen;HLA-A2 Antigen;HLA-B Antigens;HLA-B*07:02 antigen;HLA-B7 Antigen;Immunodominant Epitopes;Peptide Fragments;Recombinant Fusion Proteins;Interferon-gamma
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Amino Acid Sequence; Animals; Antigen Presentation; Cell Line; Cytotoxicity, Immunologic; Epitopes, T-Lymphocyte(immunology); Genes, MHC Class I; Genes, Synthetic; H-2 Antigens(genetics; immunology); HLA-A Antigens(genetics; immunology); HLA-A2 Antigen; HLA-B Antigens(genetics; immunology); HLA-B7 Antigen; Humans; Immunization; Immunodominant Epitopes(immunology); Interferon-gamma(metabolism); Jurkat Cells; Lymphocyte Activation; Mice; Mice, Inbred BALB C; Mice, Inbred C57BL; Mice, Transgenic; Molecular Sequence Data; Peptide Fragments(immunology); Recombinant Fusion Proteins(genetics; immunology); T-Lymphocytes, Cytotoxic(immunology)

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The epitope was imported from the TopBank database and recurated.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were immunized at the base of the tail with 50 µg epitope and 140 µg of a helper epitope (HBVc 128-140; TPPAYRPPNAPIL). Spleens were removed 11 days later and splenocytes were subjected to two rounds of in vitro stimulation for 6 days with epitope and irradiated LPS-activated spleen cells as APCs.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Splenocytes from immunized mice that were subjected to two in vitro restimulations with the epitope did not produce IFN-γ in response to the epitope presented by Jurkat cells transfected with a B*0702/Kb chimeric gene.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The epitope was imported from the TopBank database and recurated.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were immunized at the base of the tail with 50 µg epitope and 140 µg of a helper epitope (HBVc 128-140; TPPAYRPPNAPIL). Spleens were removed 11 days later and splenocytes were stimulated in vitro for 6 days with epitope and irradiated LPS-activated spleen cells as APCs.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Splenocytes from immunized mice that were subjected to one in vitro restimulation with the epitope produced IFN-γ in response to the epitope presented by Jurkat cells transfected with a A*0201/Kb chimeric gene. CD8+ T cells assayed ex vivo 11 days post-immunization also responded to the epitope.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The epitope was imported from the TopBank database and recurated. An internal source ID is assigned, because the sequence provided in the reference differs from those found by BLAST at position 9. The C-terminal Val was substituted with Ile.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The epitope was imported from the TopBank database and recurated.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were immunized at the base of the tail with 50 µg epitope and 140 µg of a helper epitope (HBVc 128-140; TPPAYRPPNAPIL). Spleens were removed 11 days later and splenocytes were subjected to two rounds of in vitro stimulation for 6 days with epitope and irradiated LPS-activated spleen cells as APCs.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Splenocytes from immunized mice that were subjected to two in vitro restimulations with the epitope produced IFN-γ in response to the epitope presented by Jurkat cells transfected with a B*0702/Kb chimeric gene.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were pretreated with by injecting cardiotoxin bilaterally into each tibialis anterior muscle. Five days later, mice were immunized with 100 µg EpiGene DNA construct containing 11 malaria epitopes and the PADRE helper epitope. Spleens were removed 11 days later and splenocytes were subjected to two rounds of in vitro stimulation for 6 days with epitope and irradiated LPS-activated spleen cells as APCs.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Splenocytes from immunized mice that were subjected to two in vitro restimulations with the epitope produced IFN-γ in response to the epitope presented by Jurkat cells transfected with a B*0702/Kb chimeric gene.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were pretreated with by injecting cardiotoxin bilaterally into each tibialis anterior muscle. Five days later, mice were immunized with 100 µg DNA (P. falciparum SSP2 gene). Spleens were removed 11 days later and splenocytes were subjected to two rounds of in vitro stimulation for 6 days with epitope and irradiated LPS-activated spleen cells as APCs.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Splenocytes from immunized mice that were subjected to two in vitro restimulations with the epitope did not produce IFN-γ in response to the epitope presented by Jurkat cells transfected with a B*0702/Kb chimeric gene. The results indicate that the epitope was not naturally processed from the antigen for presentation.

CD8+ T cells assayed ex vivo 11 days post-immunization without restimulation did not produce significant IFN-γ in response to the epitope.

Five days later, mice were immunized with 100 µg HIV gag gene DNA. Spleens were removed 11 days later and splenocytes were stimulated in vitro for 6 days with epitope and irradiated LPS-activated spleen cells as APCs.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Splenocytes from immunized mice that were subjected to one in vitro restimulation with the epitope did not produce IFN-γ in response to the epitope presented by Jurkat cells transfected with a A*0201/Kb chimeric gene. The results indicate that the epitope was not naturally processed from the antigen for presentation.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Splenocytes from immunized mice that were subjected to two in vitro restimulations with the epitope did not produce IFN-γ in response to the epitope presented by Jurkat cells transfected with a B*0702/Kb chimeric gene. The results indicate that the epitope was not naturally processed from the antigen for presentation.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were pretreated with by injecting cardiotoxin bilaterally into each tibialis anterior muscle. Five days later, mice were immunized with 100 µg EpiGene DNA construct containing 21 HIV epitopes and the PADRE helper epitope. Spleens were removed 11 days later and splenocytes were subjected to two rounds of in vitro stimulation for 6 days with epitope and irradiated LPS-activated spleen cells as APCs.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Splenocytes from immunized mice that were subjected to two in vitro restimulations with the epitope produced IFN-γ in response to the epitope presented by Jurkat cells transfected with a B*0702/Kb chimeric gene.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were immunized at the base of the tail with 50 µg epitope and 140 µg of a helper epitope (HBVc 128-140; TPPAYRPPNAPIL). Spleens were removed 11 days later and splenocytes were stimulated in vitro for 6 days with epitope and irradiated LPS-activated spleen cells as APCs.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Splenocytes from immunized mice that were subjected to one in vitro restimulation with the epitope produced IFN-γ in response to the epitope presented by Jurkat cells transfected with a A*0201/Kb chimeric gene.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were pretreated with by injecting cardiotoxin bilaterally into each tibialis anterior muscle. Five days later, mice were immunized with 100 µg HIV gag gene DNA. Spleens were removed 11 days later and splenocytes were stimulated in vitro for 6 days with epitope and irradiated LPS-activated spleen cells as APCs.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Splenocytes from immunized mice that were subjected to one in vitro restimulation with the epitope did not produce IFN-γ in response to the epitope presented by Jurkat cells transfected with a A*0201/Kb chimeric gene.
